reason: The 'row_cache_save_period' configuration in Cassandra determines how frequently the row cache is saved to disk. A shorter save period can lead to increased I/O operations, which may significantly impact overall system performance, particularly in write-heavy workloads. Conversely, a longer save period may result in higher memory consumption and potential data loss in case of a failure. Therefore, changes to this configuration can notably affect execution time and memory usage, classifying it as performance-sensitive.
